ca.mcgill.ecse211.finalproject.controller

Class Navigation

  • java.lang.Object
    • ca.mcgill.ecse211.finalproject.controller.Navigation

  • public class Navigation
extends java.lang.Object
    Class responsible for the moving of the robot throughout the competition. This means that it contains all methods responsible for moving robot by desired distances, rotating by desired angles, and traveling to desired points. The travelTo and turnTo go hand in hand as we need the robot to face the right way to go to the right location. The convert methods convert distances and angles with which the lejos motor methods can work with. Other important methods, travelToPremount and returnToOrigin, are more situational methods that are used for a specific part of the competition.

    • Method Detail

      • travelTo

        public void travelTo(double x,
                     double y)
        Method responsible to make robot travel to a certain point. This method takes care of turning towards the right angle to travel to the intended destination. The method even takes care of taking the smallest angle needed.
        Parameters:
        x - x-coordinate to travel to.
        y - y-coordinate to travel to.

      • convertDistance

        public static int convertDistance(double radius,
                                  double distance)
        Method that converts distance to travel to required wheel rotations.
        Parameters:
        radius - wheel radius.
        distance - distance to travel.
        Returns:
        wheel rotations in degrees.

      • convertAngle

        public static int convertAngle(double radius,
                               double width,
                               double angle)
        Method that converts angle to rotate by to required wheel rotations.
        Parameters:
        radius - wheel radius.
        width - distance between the wheels.
        angle - angle to rotate by in degrees.
        Returns:
        wheel rotations in degrees.

      • turnTo

        public void turnTo(double differenceInTheta)
        Method responsible to rotate robot by minimal angle to face a certain orientation.
        Parameters:
        differenceInTheta - angle to rotate by in radians.

      • advance

        public void advance(long distance,
                    boolean immediateReturn)
        Method that makes robot move by desired distance.
        Parameters:
        distance - distance to move by.
        immediateReturn - boolean that determines synchronization of motors.

      • travelToPremount

        public void travelToPremount()
        Method responsible for making robot move to a premount point in right angles (imitates square driver).
        It also handles whether to travel in x-direction or y-direction first to ensure no collision with zipline.

      • returnToOrigin

        public void returnToOrigin()
        Method responsible to return robot to its starting corner after it has located enemy's flag. This is the final piece in the puzzle to complete the challenge of capturing a flag while crossing obstacles.

      • turnToAngle

        public double turnToAngle(double x,
                          double y)
        Calculates angle to turn to for when wanting to travel to a specific point
        Parameters:
        x - x-coordinate of desired point
        y - y-coordinate of desired point
        Returns:
        angle to face to travel to desired point

      • travelToWLocalize

        public void travelToWLocalize(double x,
                              double y)
        Method which implements the travelling, but relocalizes every specified block length to ensure that the odometer is correct throughout the competition. This method only works with X and Y where either one is zero in relation to the current position of the robot. Thus, this method only works when the robot is travelling along the grid lines as it needs the lines to localize.
        Parameters:
        x - the X position of the final destination
        y - the Y position of the final destination
